description.narrative: CIP is a civil NGO based in Maputo that undertakes budget, expenditures and revenues monitoring, monitors the extractive industry, investigates corruption and advocates for transparency. It was established in 2005. It operates at national, level and is considereda key actor, as it has outstandingly good staff, does good investigative research and links with similar international organizations (Transparency International, IBP, IIED, CSA, Publish what you Pay Global Integrity platform and World Bank Institute). It has started to link with and train other national organizations. With the boom of natural resources, the work of this partner in the extractive industry has been important to ensure that revenues from the extractive industry are fairly allocatedand people benefit from them through improvement of basic services. On the AGIR Program, CIP will work on the area of Right to Participate - Responsive Government <(>&<)> Public Accountability and Right to a fair share in the country#s mineral resources. Partnership with CIP is found to be strategic for both parties as Oxfam considers that revenues from Extractive Industries if well distributed may help to reduce poverty and with CIP relevant information and evidence may be acquired to help lobbying and advocacy both at national and international level with the headquarters of mining companies.

participating-org.narrative: CENTRO DE INTEGRIDADE PÚBLICA CENTER FOR PUBLIC INTEGRITY

CIP was founded in 2005 as a NGO working on Good Governance, Transparency and Integrity and has since developed research, campaigning and lobbying on the themes of Decentralization and Local Governance, Elections and Political Funding, Fiscal Transparency, Procurement, Social Control, Oversight and Anti-Corruption, Foreign Aid and Dependence, Monitoring Anti-Poverty Programming, Extractive Industries and Forestry. The organization is funded through a common fund, with participation of sixpartners (Switzerland, Denmark, Norway, Oxfam Novib, IBIS and DFID).
CIP is a recognized actor in civil society at national and international level. He is a member of the G20 and Forum de Monitoria de Orcamento. CIP participates in movements and is affiliated with Transparency International. CIP is also working with IBP, IIED, CSA, Publish What You Pay Platform and Global Integrity. CIP participated as a partner in the needs assessment with the Centre for Economic Governance and AIDS in Africa (CEGAA) for preparation of the project "Participatory Budget Monitoring and Tracking Resource for Health and HIV / AIDS", a project implemented in Mozambique, Zambia, Zimbabwe <(>&<)> Malawi.
CIP is actually leading the National Platform of Natural Resources and Extractive Industryand is one of the CSO members of the EITI MSG from Mozambique, playing a very important role in the extractive sector in Mozambique.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation
